participant_abstract.sent: There were three powerpoint presentations, by Catherine, Reissa and I.
Catherine's dealt with the industrial design issues such as energy source and signal type.
In order to keep things simple, we are going to have the remote powered by two batteries and the signal will be infrared.
My powerpoint presentation was the second one, and dealt with user interface issues.
We decided to focus on a user-centered remote with limited functionality but an appealing design.
We want it to be ergonomic so that users will avoid repetitive stress injury, and we want it to have a trendy and cool look.
The third presentation was from Reissa and dealt with marketing issues.
Her studies showed that people typically find their remotes unattractive and that there are too many buttons.
Many of the younger people surveyed would like speech recognition in their remote, but older people were not keen on this and we decided it was too expensive for us anyhow.

participant_actions.sent: Rik will summarize the last meeting and respond to spam.
Catherine will maybe explore using bluetooth.
Reissa will try to more closely determine our ideal demographic.
I will start working on more specific design ideas; the look and feel of the remote.

participant_decisions.sent: A simple well-designed remote with limited functionality.
We want it to represent the Real Reaction brand (colors and logo).
We want it to be fashionable.

participant_problems.sent: Our marketing person has a lot of ideas that would break our budget.
